meanings.sent1: The phony diamond turned out to be just a piece of glass.
meanings.sent2: She knew the designer bag was phony because the logo was crooked.
meanings.sent3: The phony magician's tricks always made the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: His smile looked as phony as a plastic flower.
meanings.sent5: The phony painting fooled everyone at first glance.

meanings.definition: Pretending to be something one is not
meanings.sent1: His phony accent slipped when he got too excited.
meanings.sent2: The phony prince was actually just a regular guy in disguise.
meanings.sent3: The phony superhero costume made him stand out at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her phony smile couldn't hide her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The phony detective solved the case with luck, not skill.

meanings.sent1: The phony apology didn't fool anyone; he wasn't sorry at all.
meanings.sent2: She gave him a phony excuse for being late to the meeting.
meanings.sent3: His phony promises never amounted to anything real.
meanings.sent4: The phony salesman tried to sell them a broken product.
meanings.sent5: Her phony kindness was just a mask for her true intentions.
